results.title: A River somewhere. - Vol. 1 & 2.
results.creator_credit: Rob Sitch, Tom Gleisner, Debra Choate, ABC-TV (Australia) and Frontline Television Productions
results.brief_description: Filmed on location in Australia, New Zealand, Venezuela, Scotland and Italy, Tom Gleisner and Rob Sitch allow their passion for fly fishing to take them around the world, visiting some of the most remote and beautiful waterways. Using a variety of transportation methods including vespa and post van, the two fishermen are determined to catch their dinner and cook it in the local style. “A River somewhere” is a viewing treat and with the wry wit and humour of Sitch and Gleisner, the program is both entertaining and visually breathtaking.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rob Sitch, Tom Gleisner, Debra Choate, ABC-TV (Australia) and Frontline Television Productions

results.title: A River runs through it
results.creator_credit: Robert Redford, Patrick Markey and Allied Filmmakers
results.brief_description: Norman Maclean’s novel has been brought to life under the skillful direction of Robert Redford and fine performances by Tom Skerrit, Brad Pitt and Craig Sheffer. Set in the mountain wilderness of Montana between 1910-1935, the story focuses on the relationship between two brothers. Their upbringing at the hands of their strict missionary father influences the boys to chose different paths. One brother goes down the road to success while the other’s path is filled with trouble and heartbreak. The two brothers share little in common except their passion for fly fishing which unites them.

results.title: A Right to refuse?
results.creator_credit: Clayton Bailey, Caroline Leaf, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “People at Work”.
Dramatization of an industrial conflict. Workers should realise that they have the right to refuse to do jobs under dangerous or unhealthy conditions.

results.title: A Return to the Rocks
results.creator_credit: John Fitzgerald, David Beal, Sydney Cove Redevelopment Authority and Audience Motivation
results.brief_description: The history of Sydney Cove and the Rocks area, shown by means of sketches, paintings, photographs and dramatisations. The Sydney Cove Redevelopment Authority has been set up to preserve the unique character of the area. Shows some of the Australia Day celebrations at the birth place of the nation. Narrated by Peter Gwynne and Tim Eliott. Written by David Whitaker. Cinematography John Fitzgerald, Oscar Scherl, Ian Stock and Foster Stubbs.

results.title: A Research brief. No. 3
results.creator_credit: John McAulay, National Film Board of Canada and Dumont Film Productions
results.brief_description: The film records projects undertaken by the National Research Council of Canada - the launching of helium balloons to measure the ozone layer, cloud seeding to help fight forest fires, a study of the Gaspe current, recommendations to alleviate the St. Laurence Seaway Bottleneck, helicopter transport of trees out of logging sites and the feasibility of rockets to carry scientific instruments into the heart of the aurora borealis.

results.title: A Research brief 2
results.creator_credit: National Film Board of Canada, National Research Council of Canada and AKO
results.brief_description: Projects undertaken by the National Research Council of Canada. This film covers the development of a new meningitis vaccine; a process to extract protein from field peas; maintenance of the NRC cesium atomic clock, solar energy research, and grinding and polishing a 14-ton mirror for the Canada-France-Hawaii telescope. Photographers, John McAulay, Grant Crabtree, Ian McKain.

results.title: A Research brief
results.creator_credit: National Film Board of Canada, National Research Council of Canada and AKO
results.brief_description: This film covers the following National Research Council projects at fort-aux-Basques harbour, Newfoundland - simulated icing of helicopters, the comet kohoutek, seaweeds, seals, an updated windmill, automation on the farm, and a revolutionary highway safety installation. Photographers, Grant Crabtree, John McAulay, Ken Orton.

results.title: A Report on safety of life at sea = SOLAS
results.creator_credit: Peter Ward, Denis Ward and Technical and Scientific Films
results.brief_description: Shows construction and testing of a new portable lifeboat radio, the “Solas” equipment, designed for transmission and reception of distress messages at sea by means of radio telephone and by automatic and manual radio telegraphy. The “Solas” (Safety of Life at Sea) equipment is demonstrated to be waterproof, capable of floating and able to withstand extremes of temperature.

results.title: A Red ribbon
results.creator_credit: Marc De Rossi, Pedro Jose Frank Nemeth, Patricia De Rossi and Ard Norddeutscher Rundfunk
results.brief_description: A non-narrated story with simply a musical score background about a young boy’s unsuccessful attempts to fly a kite. Discouraged he gives up and goes home. However, his female companion comes to his rescue with the aid of her red hair ribbon which she attaches to the tail of the kite. A sensitive film that raises issues about the value of friendship and co-operation. Music by Vincente Salvia. Cast: Ledice Fernandes de Oliviera, Marcos da Silva. Suitable for primary school level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Marc De Rossi, Pedro Jose Frank Nemeth, Patricia De Rossi and Ard Norddeutscher Rundfunk

results.title: A Record of pre-school play
results.creator_credit: Australian Council for Educational Research and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: These children are representative of 100 who commenced primary school in Carlton during 1951. Some children had attended the Lady Gowrie Pre-School Centre, some came from other kindergartens and creches and some had not attended any pre-school centre. The children were assembled for two weeks at the end of 1950 to study their vocabulary and this film was made of their unrehearsed and undirected activities. Photography by Rodney Power.
